instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMC’s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light, fan spins, no boot
threads.message:
Hi, got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with green light (no orange light with battery connected), no chime, no image. Connecting the charger fan goes on and after a while full throttle.

<CAPACITOR>C6226</CAPACITOR> was corroded and was replaced. 

Replaced BIOS chip just in case. 

Every rail until <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> is present. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is a bit low 12.2v

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 0v. 

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light, fan spins, no boot
threads.message:
Seems to have SMC issue.
Do you get correct <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light, fan spins, no boot
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light, fan spins, no boot
threads.message: Check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light, fan spins, no boot
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light, fan spins, no boot
threads.message:
Did you change DCIN board?
If yes, then change SMC.

Just in case, test disconnecting BIL.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light, fan spins, no boot
threads.message:
Yes, i tried another DCIN board.

Im sorry, what do you mean by disconnecting BIL? All the measurements were made with battery disconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B green light, fan spins, no boot
threads.message: Try disconnecting J6955, just in case.
